title: How to start freecam on a phone?

posts.content_html:
First, my English isn’t great, so I’ll be using translation tools, and my English might sound a bit off sometimes.

On PC, you can activate the official Roblox developer’s Freecam by pressing the Shift and P keys simultaneously.
However, looking at the script, it seems likely that it’s also possible on mobile devices. (This is because the control method mentions thumbsticks.)
So, how can you use Freecam on a mobile phone? Or is it not possible?

Hi! To enable freecam on mobile, you’ll first need to grab the Freecam Gui from the Player. If you take a closer look, you’ll see that the FreecamScript actually has an attribute called FreecamEnabled to it. All you need to do is add a TextButton- or script your custom behaviour when you want to toggle it.

After that, you can add this function which will help you enable it:

local Player = game:GetService("Players").LocalPlayer
local PlayerGui = Player.PlayerGui
local Freecam = PlayerGui:WaitForChild("Freecam")
local FreecamScript = Freecam:WaitForChild("FreecamScript") -- The refrence to the Freecam Script.

local function ToggleFreecam()
FreecamScript:SetAttribute("FreecamEnabled", not FreecamScript:GetAttribute("FreecamEnabled"))
end

Note: This has to be inside a LocalScript, so if you’re doing it from the Server use a RemoteEvent

Aditionally, if your Freecam is toggled by a TextButton or an ImageButton, consider adding a task.wait() and setting your GUI’s Enabled property to true.

Hope this helps. If you have any more questions feel free to ask.
